meanings.definition: All the people in a country or area who are entitled to vote in an election.
meanings.sent1: The electorate gathered at the polling station to cast their votes.
meanings.sent2: The entire electorate participated in the democratic process.
meanings.sent3: The electorate showed up in full force, ready to make their voices heard.
meanings.sent4: The power of the electorate can shape the future of a nation.
meanings.sent5: The diverse electorate reflected the true essence of democracy.

meanings.definition: The body of people entitled to vote in an election.
meanings.sent1: Every member of the electorate had a say in the election outcome.
meanings.sent2: The electorate's decision had a significant impact on the results.
meanings.sent3: The electorate's enthusiasm for voting was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The unity of the electorate was evident in their collective decision.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of the electorate is crucial for a functioning democracy.
